article.headline: Boston College 74, Miami 72 (OT)
article.story: CORAL GABLES, Fla. (AP) -- Jared Dudley scored nine of his career-high 24 points in overtime, lifting Boston College past Miami 74-72 on Wednesday night and sending the Hurricanes to their sixth straight loss. Miami's loss, coupled with Virginia Tech's 80-65 win over Georgetown, dropped the Hurricanes to 13th place in the Big East, a half-game behind the Hokies. Only the top 12 teams qualify for the Big East conference tournament. Dudley scored the Eagles' first nine points of the extra session, and gave Boston College (16-7, 5-5 Big East) the lead for good by hitting a 3-pointer with 3:10 remaining. Miami cut Boston College's lead to 73-72 with 32.0 seconds left on a 3-pointer by Guillermo Diaz and a pair of Darius Rice free throws, but dropped its fourth overtime game in as many attempts after Steve Hailey hit a free throw and Rice and Eric Wilkins missed potential game-tying shots. Diaz had 21 points, Robert Hite 13, Rice 12 and Rodrigue Djahue 10 for Miami. Neither Diaz nor Rice started the game, each sitting out the first 4:42 because of an internal team matter. Diaz's 3-pointer with 3:44 left in regulation gave Miami (13-11, 3-7) a 60-55 lead. But Miami missed five of its final six shots from the floor in regulation, while Boston College went on a 9-2 run and took a 64-62 lead on John Marshall's free throw with 20 seconds remaining. Will Frisby hit two free throws with 0.8 seconds left, forcing overtime. Miami, though, had no answer for Dudley in the extra session. Sean Marshall and Craig Smith each scored 12 points for the Eagles.
